title: Sage’s Landing
text:
Bradninch D&D
This is a open repo of notes about the world - some common knowledge. Please feel free to read as much or as little as you like.

The Devonian alps divide the known realms in two (well three if you include the gateway to the Underdark). Sitting at the centre of this natural wall, at the only sea crossing for many leagues, is Sage’s Landing. An independent city state and bastion of learning, trade and most importantly opportunity. They say that: ‘the landing’ has wealth for the taking. Anyone with the brawn, brains, or bravery can have it since the cobbles are made of gold (perhaps it’s just a reflection of the setting sun after the regular rainstorms). This is while people from all over the world flock to the city.
Sage’s Landing is a Mertiomonachy, where who sits on the throne is not decided by birthright and blood but by the rigours of meticulous examination. The person who scores highest in their SAT (Sovereign Acumen Test) will bear the mantle of leadership. The first SAT for 13 years is right around the corner. Will the encumbered king Ardent Kinnerman (kindly but said by some to be now doddery) be able to ace the test once more. Maybe, Hope, Ardent’s 13-year-old prodigy daughter may continue the family line. But the favourite is Mallodious Flint, security advisor to the king and architect of the ‘magic user and men-at-arm certification act’ more commonly known by adventurers as the irksome parchment for passage. Or perhaps you will sit the exam and become the next monarch.
Be warned, becoming monarch may not be all it seems. Sage’s Landing, strategically positioned between realms, attracts envy from powerful entities across all directions.
So where will you headfirst? To Scholar’s Summit where the Inspectorate are writing the next SAT. The Limpets, the makes-shift shanty town that grows up the sides of the city’s walls - its layout changes with each large storm but you can be sure to find anything you want so long as you’re not fussy about the paperwork that goes with it. Mothers Maw, the huge tidal cavern that serves as a refuge for ships in a storm and is home to the now sealed gateway to the Underdark. Or maybe you’ll just head to the pub.

title: 1  Sage’s Landing
text:
Scholar’s Summit
A district located at the top of Sage’s landing filled with prestigious institutions, temples, and scholarly establishments. It’s known for its tranquil atmosphere, manicured gardens, and narrow cobblestone paths.
Great Library of Arcanum
A vast and imposing library filled with ancient tomes, scrolls, and magical artifacts. It serves as the center of learning for scholars, wizards, and historians, with restricted sections guarded by powerful wards.
The Limpets
A densely packed area of slums built on the side of the walls of Sage’s Landing, home to the city’s poorest residents. It is notorious for crime, hidden dealings, and a thriving black market.

The Market of Whispers
A secretive underground market the entrance is within The Limpets where rumors, secrets, and forbidden items are traded. The stalls are filled with shadowy figures whispering clandestine deals.
The Rusty Nail
A rough and rowdy tavern located in The Limpets. It’s a favorite haunt for mercenaries, thieves, and pirates looking for cheap drinks and underhanded deals.
Mother’s Maw
A vast cave-like entrance on the outskirts of the city, rumored to lead deep into the earth. It is often regarded with a mix of awe and fear by the locals. It houses a port and market inside.

The Sealed Gate
An ancient, rune-covered gate inside of Mother’s Maw. It has remained sealed for centuries, said to be an entrance to the underdark.
The Golden Plaza
A lively, bustling square paved with golden-hued stones where merchants, performers, and adventurers gather. It’s known for its vibrant atmosphere and colorful market stalls.
The Fountain of Fortunes
A grand, ornate fountain in the center of the Golden Plaza. Throwing a coin into its waters is believed to bring good luck or a glimpse of the future.
The Sovereign Court
The political heart of Sage’s Landing, where the city’s leaders and nobility gather. It is a place of power, politics, and negotiation.



The Hall of Judgments
A solemn, imposing hall within The Sovereign Court where justice is dispensed and disputes are settled. It is known for its rigorous trials and judgments.
The Arcane Academy
A prestigious institution for the study of magic, where aspiring wizards, sorcerers, and enchanters learn their craft. The academy is filled with lecture halls, laboratories, and spellcasting chambers.



The Tower of Illusions
A mysterious tower within the Arcane Academy, dedicated to the study of illusion magic. The tower’s appearance shifts and changes, and its halls are filled with illusory traps and enchantments.
The Enchanted Garden
A magical garden on the grounds of the Arcane Academy, filled with rare plants, herbs, and magical creatures. It is a place of beauty, wonder, and occasional danger.
The Citadel of Vigilance
A formidable fortress that serves as the city’s main military stronghold. The Citadel is home to the city guard, knights, and militia who protect Sage’s Landing.
The Armory of Aegis
A secure armory within the Citadel of Vigilance, where the city’s weapons and armor are stored and maintained. It also houses enchanted arms for the elite guard.
The War Room
A strategic command center in the Citadel of Vigilance, where generals and commanders meet to plan military actions and defense strategies.
The Artisan’s Quarter
A bustling district filled with workshops, forges, and studios where artisans, craftsmen, and merchants produce and sell their wares.

The Gilded Anvil
A renowned blacksmith’s forge in the Artisan’s Quarter, known for crafting high-quality weapons, armor, and tools.
The Silken Thread
An elegant dressmaker’s shop in the Artisan’s Quarter, specializing in exquisite garments for the city’s elite, often using rare fabrics and magical materials.
The Temple of Unity
A grand temple dedicated to all the gods, where followers of different faiths come together to worship in peace and harmony.
The Hall of Echoes
A serene chamber within the Temple of Unity, known for its acoustics that amplify even the softest whisper, believed to be a place where the gods can hear mortal voices.
The Celestial Spire
A towering structure of the Temple of Unity that reaches towards the heavens. It is said to be a place of divine connection and meditation.
The Understreets
A network of underground passages, tunnels, and hideouts beneath Sage’s Landing. It’s a hidden world filled with danger, secretive dealings, and shadowy figures.
The Thieves’ Den
A secret hideout within the Understreets where thieves, cutpurses, and assassins gather to exchange information, plan heists, and fence stolen goods.
The Shadow Market
An illicit marketplace beneath the city where illegal goods, contraband, and rare items are bought and sold without prying eyes.
The Wizard’s Tower
A popular tavern in the Middle Market, known for its enchanting ambiance and arcane decor. It’s a hub for adventurers, mages, and those seeking magical services.

Tyr’s Temple
A stately temple dedicated to Tyr, the god of justice. It serves as a place of worship, law, and arbitration, where disputes are mediated, and justice is served.

Geoff’s Orphanage
A modest, well-kept orphanage run by Geoff, a former tavern owner. It is a sanctuary for Sage’s Landing’s abandoned children, currently under threat from criminal forces.

The Climb of Contemplation
A steep, rocky staircase leading to Master Lang’s temple, known for testing both physical endurance and spiritual resolve of those who ascend its many steps.

title: 2  Cast
text:
Here is an overview of the notable cast members you have met so far.
Angus ‘Gus’ Augustus ‘Gus’ Fleetfoot. Let me tell you the first rule of business. There are no rules. Landlord. Halfling man in his early 100s. Handle bar moustache as well waxed as his hair.
Sweetie Fleetfoot. Goliath Chef. Wife of Gus. White chefs clothes and huge rolling pin. Produces tiny finger food. Tussles Gus’s hair whenever she goes past.
Clover Fleetfoot. Whatever Dad. Human sized. Gus’s daughter and waitress. Surly teenager but well doing their best with the public.
Grog. Drunk man in the corner.
Kootakaar Gnome forger.
Sir Martyn Oliver. Deputy assistant inspector - closed the Wizard’s Tower
